meanings.definition: A substance that enhances the effect of another substance.
meanings.sent1: The potentiators in the medicine made it work faster.
meanings.sent2: The enzyme acted as a potentiator for the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent3: The potentiators in the recipe made the dish taste even better.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement was like a potentiator for his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight acted as a potentiator for the growth of the plants.

meanings.definition: Someone or something that increases the power or effectiveness of something else.
meanings.sent1: The team captain was a great potentiator of their performance.
meanings.sent2: Music can be a potentiator of emotions.
meanings.sent3: The potentiator, a loyal friend, always had good advice.
meanings.sent4: Laughter is a powerful potentiator of happiness.
meanings.sent5: Her smile acted as a potentiator for positivity in the room.
